intro: Cryptantha abramsii, commonly known as the Abrams' cryptantha, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its delicate, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in desert or arid environments. It produces small, cylindrical seed pods that split open to release its seeds. Cryptantha abramsii is a perennial species that plays a role in stabilizing soils in its native habitat.
